intro: Psychotria spruceana, commonly known as the Amazonian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Psychotria spruceana is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
